bibl.title: [Letter] 1834 Jan. 26, Rural Rest [to] Major Sims / Ja[mes] M[oore] King
bibl.author: King, J.M.
bibl.note: This is a one page letter dated January 26, 1834 from James Moore King to Major Sims. The subject of the letter is the preparation of a dinner for the volunteer soldiers.

projectDesc.p: Created for the University of Tennessee Digital Library

editorialDecl.p: Quotation marks retained as data except inside q tags
Errors in transcription of the printed text controlled with X-Metal 3.0 spell-checker; text has also been thoroughly proofread.
Corrections and normalization represented by editorial tags.
Catchwords and directional notes such as "turn page over" have been omitted.

refsDecl.p: ID attributes provided for only those pages, chapters, or illustrations toward which a reference or figure points.

div.opener:
Rural Rest
—26th Jany January 1834
Majr Major Sims
div.p:
In going to town yesterday their there was but fiew few
pursons persons from the country in I soon discovered their was no arraingement arrangement making for a dinner their , for the vollntears volunteers
I herd heard it said by some they understood their was a dinner going to give a dinner at
Midleton Middleton

As they appear to be no preparation for a dinner in murfreesboro , I think it would be well , to make your arraingements and have one at some convinent convenient
plaice place in that section of the county — If you go in for it, and I find out when you have a meting meeting I will endeavour to attend , but at all events you may count on my being a subscriber and will be very apt to be at the dinner —

I think it highly important that we ⁁ show the token of gratitude in the receptiol reception of our Brave Patriotick Patriotic and suffering Soaldiers Soldiers , by inviting them to the festival boar partake with us at the festival board , where we can congratilat congratulate them for their Patriotism vallor valor and their return to their friend & county If it takes plaice rite write me
div.closer:
Yours Resspectfuly Respectfully —
Ja M James Moore King
